questions.title: Two Numbers That Add Up (Explain Only)
questions.prompt: Explain how you would find two numbers in a small list that add up to a target, without writing code.
followups: Would you check all pairs or remember past numbers?
What edge case would you test first?

questions.title: Reverse a String (Steps)
questions.prompt: Explain step by step how you would reverse a string like "amazon".
followups: How do you know when to stop?
How do you verify the result?

questions.title: Palindrome Check
questions.prompt: Explain how you would check if a word reads the same forward and backward.

questions.title: Find the Largest Number
questions.prompt: Explain how you would find the largest number in a list.
followups: How do you track the current maximum?
What if the list is empty?

questions.title: Counting Items
questions.prompt: Explain how you would count how many times each item appears in a list.
followups: What is the key and value?

questions.title: Remove Duplicates (Conceptual)
questions.prompt: Explain how you would remove duplicate items from a list.
followups: What edge case would you test?

questions.title: Binary Search (Idea Only)
questions.prompt: Explain how you could search a sorted list faster than checking every item.
followups: Why must the list be sorted?

questions.title: Merge Two Sorted Lists
questions.prompt: Explain how you would merge two sorted lists into one sorted list.
followups: What happens when one list ends?

questions.title: Valid Parentheses (Idea Level)
questions.prompt: Explain how you would check if brackets in a string are correctly matched.

questions.title: Loops (Practical Use)
questions.prompt: Explain when and why you would use a loop.
followups: What happens if a loop never stops?

questions.title: If Statements
questions.prompt: Explain how an if statement helps a program make decisions.
followups: What happens if the condition is false?

questions.title: Functions (Purpose)
questions.prompt: Explain why functions are useful in programming.

questions.title: Variables (Usage)
questions.prompt: Explain how variables help store and manage data.

questions.title: Arrays vs Lists
questions.prompt: Explain one difference between arrays and lists.

questions.title: Big-O (Plain English)
questions.prompt: Explain what Big-O helps developers think about, without formulas.

questions.title: Debugging Basics
questions.prompt: Your code is not working. Explain the first steps you would take to debug it.
followups: When do you ask for help?

questions.title: Testing Basics
questions.prompt: Explain how you would test a small function.
followups: What happens if you skip testing?

questions.title: APIs (Usage)
questions.prompt: Explain how an app might use an API to get data.
followups: What data could an API return?

questions.title: REST Basics
questions.prompt: Explain what a REST API is using a simple example.

questions.title: Frontend vs Backend
questions.prompt: Explain how frontend and backend work together.

questions.title: Leadership Principle: Customer Obsession
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you improved something based on user feedback.
followups: How did you get the feedback?

questions.title: Leadership Principle: Ownership
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you took responsibility for a task.

questions.title: Leadership Principle: Bias for Action
questions.prompt: Describe a time you acted quickly to solve a problem.

questions.title: Leadership Principle: Learn and Be Curious
questions.prompt: Tell me about something technical you learned quickly.

questions.title: Leadership Principle: Dive Deep
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you investigated a problem to find the root cause.

questions.title: Leadership Principle: Earn Trust
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you earned trust on a team.

questions.title: Leadership Principle: Deliver Results
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you delivered results under pressure.

questions.title: Why Amazon?
questions.prompt: Why do you want to intern at Amazon?
followups: Which leadership principle fits you best?
What Amazon product do you like?
What do you want to learn?

questions.title: Find the Smallest Number
questions.prompt: Explain how you would find the smallest number in a list of integers.
followups: How is this similar to finding the largest?
What if all numbers are negative?
Why is this a common interview question?

questions.title: Sorting Concepts
questions.prompt: Explain why sorting data can be helpful in programming.
followups: What operations become easier with sorted data?
Name a real Amazon use case for sorting

questions.title: Data Structures for Shopping Cart
questions.prompt: What data structure would you use to store items in an Amazon shopping cart?
followups: How would you handle adding/removing items?

questions.title: String Concatenation
questions.prompt: Explain how you would combine two strings together.
followups: Why is this useful in real programs?
How would you combine multiple strings?

questions.title: Basic Error Handling
questions.prompt: Explain what you would do if your program encounters an error.
followups: Why is it important to handle errors?
What information should error messages provide?
How does error handling improve user experience?

questions.title: Comments in Code
questions.prompt: Explain why adding comments to code can be helpful.

questions.title: Version Control Basics
questions.prompt: Explain why using version control (like Git) is important for team projects.
followups: How does it help with collaboration?
What happens if you make a mistake?
Why does Amazon use version control?

questions.title: Simple Amazon Product Search
questions.prompt: Explain how you would search for a product in a small list of Amazon items.
followups: What information would you search by?
How would you handle multiple matches?
What if the product isn't found?

questions.title: Calculate Order Total
questions.prompt: Explain how you would calculate the total price of items in an order.
followups: How would you handle taxes or discounts?

questions.title: Check Stock Availability
questions.prompt: Explain how you would check if an Amazon product is in stock.
followups: How would you display the result to users?
What if stock changes while processing?

questions.title: User Input Validation
questions.prompt: Explain why it's important to validate user input in forms.
followups: What types of validation are important?
How does this protect Amazon's systems?

questions.title: Simple Recommendation System
questions.prompt: Explain a basic way Amazon might recommend products to users.
followups: How simple could you make this?

questions.title: Track Package Status
questions.prompt: Explain how you would track the status of an Amazon package.
followups: What statuses might a package have?
How would you update the status?
How would you display this to customers?

questions.title: Handle Multiple User Sessions
questions.prompt: Explain why websites need to handle multiple users at once.
followups: What problems could occur with multiple users?
How does Amazon handle millions of users?
Why is this important for shopping sites?

questions.title: Database Basics
questions.prompt: Explain why Amazon needs databases to store information.
followups: What types of data would Amazon store?

questions.title: Caching Concept
questions.prompt: Explain why caching frequently accessed data can improve performance.
followups: What Amazon data might be cached?
How does caching help during busy times?

questions.title: Mobile vs Desktop Experience
questions.prompt: Explain why Amazon might need different experiences for mobile and desktop.
followups: Why is mobile important for shopping?

questions.title: Accessibility Basics
questions.prompt: Explain why making websites accessible to all users is important.
followups: Why does Amazon care about accessibility?

questions.title: Security Basics
questions.prompt: Explain why security is crucial for Amazon's systems.
followups: What sensitive data does Amazon handle?

questions.title: Scaling Concepts

followups: What challenges come with more users?

questions.title: Team Collaboration
